intro: Galarhoeus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and hairy foliage, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are alternate and linear, with a pubescent surface that provides protection against desiccation. Galarhoeus pubescens is adapted to withstand harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
